intro: Fuirena robusta, commonly known as the robusta fuirena, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features robust, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Fuirena robusta is well adapted to the volcanic soils and coastal climates of its native habitat.
